jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

3D9E3C51F6724E75ACE8F5B1AFF77448.description: CSIS5: Recite prayers and poems of substance that encourage all to strive for virtue and goodness.

A90628A6DAB4451180984BFA76DC8FD7.description:
Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification. (See Grade 3 Language standards 1
and 3 for specific expectations.)

658FA0BC35BB426FA16D697D28073730.description:
Create engaging audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to
emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

1ED2EFFDE2374DC792B20481152E2B08.description:
Report on a topic or text (including Catholic/religious texts), tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details,
speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

BE58CEB83E0E48A7BDC6F521032022C1.description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

8CA7C4E3A37747C081FDFA8C44693590.description:
Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively, and orally.

27961615FB3D42D08D331A6FB4D5E89A.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion

7CA1B695C74D44BCBE96C58A8B97628B.description:
Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others in a respectful
manner.

9CFA5BE829DE46B894E2770E2F9B8814.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the
topics and texts under discussion).

BAA9A531D7DC4103BF7AA1EB0861008F.description:
Prepare for discussions (having read or studied required material); explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the
topic to explore ideas under discussion.

D32D866C99B341DEA0BB564C9D76221B.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led), building on others’ ideas and expressing their own
clearly

617744E314B5461192989916E6F08BEB.description: Share the beauty and cadence of poetry for its impact on human sensibilities and formation of the soul. CSDS9

9960AFBA49B649AD99902CA29D4F89DD.description: Delight and wonder through reading aloud or listening to creative, sound, and healthy stories, and poems and plays. CSDS7

B8A3E75D770C4F18914E2F9906EF03E9.description: Share beautifully told and well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

C7490204D5914B83BCE54057613C06EF.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

4A1991DD605D489591596257EC3434F6.description: Listen attentively and display appropriate reverence during prayer time and in Church.

6E18DC7B0B6C40CDA524987B7EF7B2B6.description: Catholic Standards for Speaking and Listening

7AF7D7C3FFF74B49B016A90B4F9122C8.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal spatial
and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that night we went looking for them).

B2A7909DB880431FB481C2F65EFEA620.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard,
wondered).

1FFAB0EF896D42D98ACD487BED1498B2.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).

B38116FCCEAE4AF6B6614BE34C513075.description: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

1D7C7B1A4869463485F4C766CE06F5ED.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

F821EBF315694A348A87F261B575AB8B.description: Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

AF1C2310C4DB4FEDB95BC2FB080601FB.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

D97C91538B3246D0896D5CF5CD2F32A3.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable,
comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

C1836343D2E849E3BB53860E6D3F58FE.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

0E6C70F28B11485A9B9E52A787B90247.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on Grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a
range of strategies.

0D19322B5FD44BBFB044EA2943B9342F.description: Recognize and observe differences between the conventions of spoken and written standard English.

6713BA97152340AAAC400247858BC28B.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.

5786C40233B5402AA268BF4DAC4C3CDB.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening

F160948AFFF54313A0D8914D16A76EDA.description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

B5E7FDA5719D4D00907CF9D9604E0C3A.description:
Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings, syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) in
writing words.

B3A38833275F4AAF835A86FF9B18F928.description: Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and for adding suffixes to base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).

03AA8762FD464CB5B68BC0B73B73813B.description: Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.

9E5077A78D8240C0AC48DD4C97100699.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

2EED09E0D8FA4A1CB0734E66CA868CE0.description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

B9DC0DB41E1842C1893A3CAF65D29F89.description: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

A5A9F9E28F6C48BF9B3493F973E338F4.description: Form and use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.

FCE1961C5CED4F1387466B1ECB0636E9.description: Form and use regular and irregular verbs.

D0584CB66A1B4A00AA15279D83F2050B.description: Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.

8F24A4F30CD241AA859B5756CB366196.description: Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

A6B1F9458BD44B188049B32D39AEE025.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

67181D3D302E4A2883E85195E8114051.description: Use language to order our thoughts and to accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

BBCE53E54A9B47E38CC596D6F3CF67DE.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

F43D204EB04145F7AFE884C839980B4F.description: Exhibit an understanding that words are important to the Word.

F9D821BFCF2E4E38BD1AB7D2C6C170F2.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range
of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

B94B2F6B946949A1B422F02EF8882464.description:
Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided
categories. Reference sources.

CADB1A66CE3A4BF988DB7963DA1B02BE.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic. Reference sources.

223C8C0CF4864D25829D73AA3969C29B.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

422DD8921D274E53AE6A94A997E5B738.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use traditional tools as well as technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., prayers, Catholic theme) as well as
to interact and collaborate with others.

004BE87A67C944CDB38E88F2FFB352AA.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.

D6DA0BD184AF4545AAECF7D88F3BA4DF.description: With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.

DF0540FA066643F8A5C74277955631DF.description: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

BBA469D266024DCB863C3D65050A00D1.description: Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

5E5AC117B83947C48B2502E8D10B4756.description: Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

5A0BCF8957854AD6878FA94A13E2FB76.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

5F004B4FB8ED49D285473BF721D930FE.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

F2B202876ED84241BAD71DE226D3A605.description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.

62CB2CAB57F84BD8AC1A9ED5273CD516.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details that are organized in paragraphs or sections.

006C29FC9CBA48E885CAF381366ACAB1.description: Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.

B6EC2B29722A4EC5B63662595430D3A1.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic (including but not limited to a Catholic topic) and convey ideas and information clearly.

856202D654D64028873BD163A9AC9FAB.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

434D3CCD348F44818EE66A2D305EB6CB.description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.

9F68C74B84664815A822E4FBE85B354D.description: Create an organizational structure (paragraph) in which opinion is supported by reasons, facts, and details.

4B32EFA6686F41CC8D5396DA23D6102A.description: Introduce the topic or text they are writing about and state an opinion.

A8B1F8CE419C42919F9F61C571B537C1.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts (including Catholic/religious topics), supporting a point of view with reasons.

2822848896C8461CA998D46E0376BEF7.description: CSIS14: Write to explore reasoning and intent.

C376E0A1A83D457B813DC05AAB868CC2.description: CSIS8: Write to develop personal judgment based on truth, goodness and virtue.

2E8A11387A3C4F41B31DAFBEDC63012C.description: CSIS2: Write how spiritual knowledge and truth are represented and communicated through fairy tales, fables, myths, parables, and stories.

B0965EC8770345DC9444C2AB13B145A0.description: Write in ways to order our thoughts, align them with truth, and accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

E73AD8C7265D4CB08EF9F09FA6342F33.description: Share well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

D20E43C66DDB491A853903EDEFE87BCC.description: Create written works that glorify the Creator, reflect the heart of the Redeemer and are inspired by the Spirit.
